$NVDA Stairs up elevator down...

$NVDA I think it is a good long term investment. But in the short-term (next 6 months or so), we will be in a bear market. So, we can expect this to drop another 20% or so over the next weeks (sure, there will be a couple of bump ups). But this, as well as the rest of the market is tanking. This is just my opinion.

$NVDA Major resistance at 187 today.  
 
Yesterday 187 acted as support for essentially the entire day, that is, until the end of the day, where it plunged below it AH. 187 has now become resistance.  
 
NVDA needs to reverse above 187 soon otherwise it will begin heading towards the next support level which I believe is 178-180.  
 
NVDA is clearly in a short-term downtrend and direly needs a catalyst to cease the bleeding. It's likely that we test 180 by earnings if this movement continues. I believe ER will be the catalyst that either sends this back over 200 or nosedives it below 180.  
 
Bullish on the company long-term and I believe now is a solid time to add/DCA for the long term, however, just be aware that the stock is going to be very volatile in the short-run and this is likely not the bottom. 
 
https://www.fool.com/investing/2022/04/27/why-nvidia-stock-keeps-dropping/ 
 
This article from MF sums it up nicely. There is short-term fear in semis, yet, the long-term outlook is still bright.

$NVDA At 325 this stock was a joke. Over 100x earnings and near 30x sales. Absolutely insane for even the most bullish of investors. 

At 180s this is different. We're hitting 100 week on the 5y. We have a price to earnings multiple of 50x which still seem ls high but at least it's not insane. Price to sales is still high as well at mid teens. 

This is not a jump in with both feet level, but I wouldn't be opposed to anyone saying they are starting here. Just realise that it could decline another 20-30% or so from here. Personally I would be interested at 40x trailing with an assumption that it could go to 25x ish forward earnings. This would results in prices between 160 and 120 give or take depending on what estimates you use.

Good luck friends! ✌️
